title: Question 14:
description: Are there fees for investing in pools?

fields.title: Answer
fields.value:
Managers may charge a performance fee and/or management fees as an incentive to share their trading strategies with the wider market or their whitelisted partners. One industry benchmark is for managers to capture a 2% fee on total assets under management (the management fee) and 20% fee on newly generated profits (the performance fee). 

With the dHedge protocol, managers also have an incentive to offer competitive fee structures as they will be competing against algorithmic strategies and other traders to manage a larger size of assets -- and their performance can be scrutinized in real-time.

fields.title: ​
fields.value:
In the future, DHT token holders may elect to access a percentage fee on the total returns generated by the most successful traders. Fees may also accrue to DHT holders from the performance of quantitative and algorithmic trading strategies. Both potential fee structures must be debated on and decided on by the dHedge community who will govern the dHedge protocol and ultimately the dhDAO.
